content.description: A small two finger pocket line will lead you right to the top of the route. Lots of good finger strength will be a big help on this climb.
content.protection: Crash pads are kinda hard to place so make sure you have a spotter to help you with this one
content.location: Big over hung rock. Farthest rock back in the big group of boulders

content.description: A large jug line following the edge of a hungover boulder. crux is between the second and third jugs. fun little line.
content.location: Directly across from no more beer (V0) look for the obvious chalk marks in the jugs.

content.description: Great rock, lots of small learnign pockets. very fun to climb over and over. the crux is the very first moves. once to the top, just slide down the sloped side.
content.location: the south side of the big triangular shaped rock. on the right hand side of the road. once climbed. just slide down the sloped side of the rock

content.description: Start in two good pockets and make several big dyno moves to good holds. Top out between the pinnacle of the boulder and the tree. Be careful of a fall near the top. It most likely won't go well.
content.location: Big overhung rock. Farthest rock back in the big group of boulders.

content.description: Starts low on the overhanging face with a good pocket and slope. Two good pockets mark the beginning of the stand start where the style changes from tough and fingery in pockets to big move on good holds. Top out in between the pinnacle of the boulder and the tree.
content.location: Big overhung rock. Farthest rock on the left in the big group of boulders.
